_README: Evidence-based activities for each wellness mode. Activities are researched and designed to be helpful, not corny. Each activity includes: id (unique identifier), text (title), explain (step-by-step instructions), duration (seconds), and icon (emoji or path).

surviving.explain: Breathe in for 4 seconds. Hold for 7 seconds. Breathe out for 8 seconds. Repeat 3 times.
Name 5 things you see. Name 4 things you can touch. Name 3 things you hear. Name 2 things you smell. Name 1 thing you taste.
Turn on cold water. Splash your face 3-5 times. Pat dry. Notice the sensation.
Get an ice cube. Hold it in your hand. Focus on the cold sensation. Hold for 30 seconds or until it melts.
Sit or stand. Press both feet firmly into the floor. Notice the solid ground supporting you. Hold for 10 seconds.
Breathe in for 4 seconds. Hold for 4 seconds. Breathe out for 4 seconds. Hold for 4 seconds. Repeat 4 times.
Say out loud: I am in [location]. I am safe right now. Repeat 3 times slowly.
Notice your head. Notice your shoulders. Notice your chest. Notice your belly. Notice your legs. Notice any tension.
Find something soft. Touch it and notice how it feels. Find something smooth. Touch it. Find something rough. Touch it.
Turn on cold water. Run it over your wrists for 30 seconds. Notice the cooling sensation. Pat dry.
Tense your shoulders for 5 seconds, then release. Tense your fists for 5 seconds, then release. Tense your jaw for 5 seconds, then release.
Pick one color (like blue or red). Count every object you can see in that color. Say the number out loud.
Find peppermint, citrus, coffee, or any strong scent. Smell it slowly 3 times. Focus only on the smell.
Find something heavy like a book or water bottle. Hold it in both hands. Feel its weight. Hold for 20 seconds.
Stand facing a wall. Place both hands on it. Push hard for 10 seconds. Release and notice how you feel.
Breathe in for 3 seconds. Hold for 3 seconds. Breathe out for 3 seconds. Repeat 5 times.
Say out loud the full date, current time, and day of the week. Repeat it twice slowly.
Get ice-cold water. Take small sips slowly. Notice the cold sensation in your mouth and throat. Finish the glass.
Cross your arms over your chest. Tap your right shoulder, then left shoulder. Keep alternating slowly. Do this 20 times.
Close your eyes. Picture the safest place you know. See every detail. Stay there in your mind for one minute.

drifting.explain: Put on shoes. Step outside. Walk for 5 minutes at any pace. Come back when ready.
Pick a song that makes you feel good. Press play. Listen all the way through.
Find a protein-rich snack like nuts, cheese, or yogurt. Eat it slowly. Notice the taste.
Find a sunny spot by a window or outside. Sit there. Soak up the sun for 5 minutes.
Pick one very small task. It could be putting dishes away or throwing out trash. Do it now.
Take a quick shower. Use warm water. Put on fresh clothes. Notice how you feel after.
Think of someone you like. Send them a simple hello text. No need to have a long chat.
Put on a song you like. Move your body however feels good. Dance until the song ends.
Reach arms up. Touch your toes. Twist left and right. Roll your neck. Stretch your legs.
Pick one table or counter. Put everything in its place or in a box. Make it clear.
Fill a glass with water. Drink it slowly. Notice how refreshing it feels.
Look outside. Watch birds, trees, clouds, or anything natural. Just observe for 5 minutes.
Turn on a show you've seen before and love. Watch one scene or 10 minutes. Enjoy it.
Make something easy like toast with butter or fruit with peanut butter. Eat and enjoy.
Open at least one window. Let fresh air flow in. Take a deep breath of the fresh air.
If you have a pet, spend 5 minutes with them. Pet them, play, or just sit together.
Find a video that makes you laugh. It can be comedy, animals, or anything funny. Watch it.
Light a candle, use essential oil, or spray something that smells good. Breathe it in.
Get paper and something to draw with. Color or doodle whatever you want for 5 minutes. No rules.
Open voice recorder on your phone. Talk about how you're feeling. No one else will hear it.

grounded.explain: Sit comfortably. Close your eyes. Focus only on your breath. When your mind wanders, bring it back to your breath. Continue for 5 minutes.
Get paper or your phone. Write down 3 things you're grateful for today. They can be big or small.
Lie down or sit. Start at your head. Notice sensations. Move slowly down to your toes. Notice everything you feel without judging.
Make tea or coffee. Sit down with it. Take each sip slowly. Notice the warmth, taste, and smell. No phone or TV.
Sit upright. Close your eyes. Focus on your breath or a word like 'calm.' When thoughts come, let them pass. Continue for 10 minutes.
Go outside. Walk slowly. Listen to every sound. Feel the air. Look at plants and sky. Stay present with nature.
Sit quietly. Say to yourself: May I be happy. May I be healthy. May I be safe. May I be at ease. Repeat for 5 minutes.
Sit still. Ask yourself: What am I feeling right now? Name the emotion. Don't try to change it. Just notice it.
Find a quiet space. Do slow, easy stretches. Move with your breath. Child's pose, cat-cow, and gentle twists work well.
Get paper or open a doc. Write whatever comes to mind for 10 minutes. Don't stop to edit. Just write.
Choose one meal. Turn off all screens. Eat slowly. Taste each bite. Notice textures and flavors.
Stop what you're doing. Notice 5 things in this exact moment. They can be sights, sounds, or feelings.
Think about what truly matters to you. Write down 3-5 core values. Ask yourself if you're living by them.
Sit comfortably. Count each breath up to 50. If you lose count, start over. Focus only on counting.
Think about what your body does for you. Thank your legs for carrying you. Thank your heart for beating. Keep going.
Put on instrumental or calm music. Sit or lie down. Close your eyes. Just listen for 10 minutes.
Dim lights. Put phone away. Do calming activities like reading or stretching. Prepare for sleep.
Put your phone in another room. Set a timer for 30 minutes. Do anything except use your phone.
Think of one boundary you need. It could be saying no or asking for space. Decide to honor it today.
Notice negative self-talk. Replace it with what you'd say to a good friend. Be gentle with yourself.

growing.explain: Write one goal that is Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound. Make it clear and doable.
Pick a topic you're curious about. Watch a video, read an article, or listen to a podcast for 15 minutes.
Choose one skill you're working on. Practice it for 15-20 minutes with focus.
Close your eyes. Picture yourself 1 year from now at your best. What do you see? What are you doing? Write it down.
Think of something just outside your comfort zone. It should feel a bit scary but doable. Do it today.
Pick a book about personal growth, skills, or a topic you want to learn. Read one chapter.
Think of someone you admire or learn from. Send them a message. Ask a question or just say thanks.
Write down 5 things you accomplished recently. They can be big or small. Celebrate them.
Choose one small positive habit you want to start. Do it once today. It could be as simple as making your bed.
Spend 20 minutes on something creative. It could be writing, art, music, or any creative work.
Think of something you're working on. Ask someone you trust for constructive feedback. Be open to it.
Reach out to someone in your field or area of interest. Send a message. Start a conversation.
Think of one thing you're good at. Find a way to use that strength intentionally today.
If you're taking an online course, complete one lesson. If not, start a free course on something you want to learn.
Write down your current morning routine. Think of one way to make it better. Try it tomorrow.
Think about this past week. What went well? What did you learn? What will you do differently? Write it down.
Think of a goal you've been avoiding. Take one small step toward it today. Just one step.
Think of someone who helped you. Write them a thank you note or message. Send it.
Make two lists. One: things that drain your energy. Two: things that give you energy. Look for patterns.
Think of something you accomplished recently, big or small. Take a moment to really celebrate it. You earned it.

quickWins.explain: Breathe in slowly. Breathe out slowly. Do this 3 times.
Stretch both arms up as high as you can. Hold for 5 seconds. Bring them down.
Take a few sips of water. Notice how refreshing it feels.
Stand up from your chair. Sit back down. Repeat 5 times.
Shake your arms, legs, and whole body for 10 seconds. Let loose.
Slowly roll your neck in a circle. Go left, then right.
Lift your shoulders to your ears. Drop them. Do this 10 times.
Make circles with both wrists. Go one way, then the other. 10 times each.
Point your toes down. Flex them up. Repeat 5 times.
Rub your temples in small circles. Massage your jaw. Do this for 15 seconds.
Go to sink. Splash cold water on your face 3 times. Pat dry.
Look in a mirror. Smile at yourself for 5 seconds.
Look out a window. Notice what you see for 20 seconds.
Pick one tiny space. Put 3 things away or throw them out.
Open your email. Delete or archive 5 old messages.
Think of a song you love. Add it to a playlist.
Think of one thing you're grateful for right now.
Say one positive thing about yourself out loud.
Feel your feet on the floor. Press them down. Notice the solid ground.
Rub your hands together. Massage each palm and finger for 20 seconds.
Jump and spread arms and legs. Bring them back. Do 10 times.
Put both hands on a wall. Push hard for 10 seconds.
Stand on one leg. Balance for 10 seconds. Switch legs.
On hands and knees, arch your back up. Dip it down. Repeat 5 times.
Reach one arm up and over. Feel the side stretch. Switch sides.
Stand. Bend forward and let your arms hang. Hold for 10 seconds.
Clasp hands behind your back. Pull shoulders back. Open your chest. Hold 10 seconds.
Stand. Make big circles with your hips. Go 5 times each way.
Lift your knees high and march in place for 20 seconds.
Run in place lifting your knees high. Do 10 on each side.
Jog in place kicking your heels to your butt. Do 10 each side.
Make big circles with both arms. Go forward 5 times, backward 5 times.
Stand. Twist your upper body left, then right. Do 10 times.
Close your eyes. Take a deep breath. Rest for 20 seconds.
Open your mouth and yawn. Stretch your whole body big.
Force a big smile or a laugh for 10 seconds. Notice how it feels.
Hum a song you love for 20 seconds.
Put your phone in another room or a drawer. Leave it there.
Set a timer for 5 minutes. Take a real break.
Think of one thing you did well recently. Celebrate it in your mind.
